definition: lift, raise
examples: heaved the trunk onto the table

definition: throw, cast
examples: heaved her books on the floor

definition: to utter with obvious effort or with a deep breath
to cause to swell or rise
examples: a spent horse gasping and heaving his chest

definition: to displace (something, such as a rock stratum or a mineral vein) especially by a fault
to draw, pull, or haul on (something, such as a rope)
elevate
to rise and fall rhythmically
examples: The boat heaved up and down on the waves.

definition: pant
examples: runners heaving at the finish line

definition: pull, push
to move a ship in a specified direction or manner
to move in an indicated way
to rise or become thrown or raised up
examples: Roads had begun to heave with frost.

definition: retch, vomit
examples: nearly heaved at the gruesome sight

definition: to strain or labor to do something difficult : struggle
to halt the headway of a ship (as by positioning a sailboat with the jib aback and the rudder turned sharply to windward)
an effort to pull or raise something
examples: with each heave of the rope

definition: an act or instance of throwing : hurl
examples: gave the ball a heave toward the basket

definition: an upward motion : rising, a rhythmical rising
horizontal displacement especially by the faulting of a rock
examples: the total heave of the strata

definition: chronic pulmonary emphysema of the horse resulting in difficult expiration, heaving of the flanks, and a persistent cough
